activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan David Vieth

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Defendant Ryan David Vieth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mitchell Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Deft heard - has reviewed and understands charges an max penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard - has spoken to the PD, but does not qualify.
Atty Crowell is present and is heard - will take the case, pending a conflict check.
ADA provides copy of complaint.
8:47 recess.
8:49 back on record.
Atty Crowell will take the case.
Court speaks to Deft.
Atty Crowell will be appointed by Dean appointment.
Deft understands.
Deft to repay dean fees at $100 per month.
Deft to complete a Dean form.
8:50 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:37 PM Defendant Ryan David Vieth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Schraven is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Schraven heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal reading.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Schraven heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today w/o a valid Rx.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
2:40 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
